dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: The White House, plunged into darkness at 10:45 p.m., like a stage going black before a storm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The White House, plunged into darkness at ten forty five p.m., like a stage going black before a storm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Washington, D.C. saw the lights illuminating the White House go out sometime around 11 p.m. EST, as protesters set off fireworks nearby, with police responding by firing tear gas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that was the seventh night of protests in D.C., right? It started peaceful but then just... erupted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that was the seventh night of protests in D.C., right? It started peaceful but then just... erupted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The sixth night of protests in Washington, D.C., sparked by the death of George Floyd, went from peaceful to turbulent as the lights illuminating the White House went dark while looters took goods from shops and protesters set fires across the capitol⁠ as President Trump remained out of public sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Um, it's heartbreaking. The report mentions St. Paul's Church—fires were set in its basement. A historic place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Um, it's heartbreaking. The report mentions St. Paul's Church-fires were set in its basement. A historic place.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fires were set across the city, according to earlier reports, including in the basement of the historic St. Johns Church.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the looting—Sephora, Nike, Target... protesters using baseball bats to smash glass. It's just chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the looting-Sephora, Nike, Target... protesters using baseball bats to smash glass. It's just chaos.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grocery stores were looted around the capitol, along with a Sephora, a Nike store, a CVS drugstore, a Target and a local liquor store, with protesters using baseball bats to smash glass to gain access to goods.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, President Trump was out of sight, tweeting about "LAW AND ORDER" but not addressing the public directly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, President Trump was out of sight, tweeting about L A W A N D O R D E R but not addressing the public directly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump addressed Floyds death during his address at Saturdays SpaceX launch, but has largely remained out of the public eye since. He has, however, tweeted about the protests, proclaiming LAW AND ORDER! around 7 p.m. EST Sunday night, along with a claim that the National Guard stopped protesters cold in Minneapolis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He was actually taken to a bunker on Friday, for precaution, which says something about the tension.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He was actually taken to a bunker on Friday, for precaution, which says something about the tension.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the National Guard activated in 22 states plus D.C.—that's an incredible number. Over 2,600 arrests nationwide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the National Guard activated in twenty two states plus D.C.-that's an incredible number. Over two thousand, six hundred arrests nationwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ABC News reported that the National Guard has been activated in 21 states plus Washington, D.C. BIG NUMBER 2,564. Thats how many people were arrested over the weekend in connection to protests around the country, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: All sparked by George Floyd's death. Derek Chauvin's been charged, but the family wants first-degree murder.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: All sparked by George Floyd's death. Derek Chauvin's been charged, but the family wants first-degree murder.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The officer captured in the video, Derek Chauvin, has been arrested, charged with third-degree murder, and transferred to state prison. Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder, while the Minneapolis police chief has said Chauvin, along with the three other officers seen in the video, bear responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the Minneapolis police chief said all four officers bear responsibility. It's a systemic issue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the Minneapolis police chief said all four officers bear responsibility. It's a systemic issue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Floyds family have called for Chauvins charge to be upgraded to first-degree murder, while the Minneapolis police chief has said Chauvin, along with the three other officers seen in the video, bear responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And this is happening during a pandemic, with mass unemployment... it's like everything colliding at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is happening during a pandemic, with mass unemployment... it's like everything colliding at once.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The death of George Floyd sparked nationwide outrage, coming amid the coronavirus pandemic and mass unemployment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The graffiti on the Washington Memorial too—it feels like a raw, visible cry for change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The graffiti on the Washington Memorial too-it feels like a raw, visible cry for change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sites around the National Mall were marked with graffiti, including the Lincoln Memorial, following Saturdays protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But turning to destruction... it's hard to see how that moves things forward, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But turning to destruction... it's hard to see how that moves things forward, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I think people are just... out of options. When peaceful protest feels ignored, frustration boils over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think people are just... out of options. When peaceful protest feels ignored, frustration boils over.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, setting fires and looting local businesses—it hurts the community more than anything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, setting fires and looting local businesses-it hurts the community more than anything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True. But the core issue, police brutality... that video of Chauvin kneeling on Floyd's neck—it's haunting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True. But the core issue, police brutality... that video of Chauvin kneeling on Floyd's neck-it's haunting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Frustrations with police brutality towards black people boiled over after a video of a white Minneapolis police officer kneeling on Floyds neck⁠with three other officers standing by⁠went viral.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And now his wife filed for divorce? It's like everything unraveling at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And now his wife filed for divorce? It's like everything unraveling at once.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: (His wife has also filed for divorce).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Let's hope this leads to real accountability, not just more division.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Let's hope this leads to real accountability, not just more division.
